def is_tv_in_room(room: item):
    # Function to check if theres a TV inside a given room
    symbol tv_in_room = exists tv: item : is_television(tv) and inside(tv, room)
    return tv_in_room

behavior __goal__():
    body:
        if exists room: item : is_room(room) and is_tv_in_room(room):
            # Check if theres any room with a TV based on the available information
            bind room: item where:
                is_room(room) and is_tv_in_room(room)
            achieve close_char(char, room)
            # Move closer to the room with TV

        else:
            # If no room with a TV is known, start exploring all rooms to find it
            foreach room: item:
                if is_room(room) and not visited(room):
                    observe(room, "Check if there is a TV inside the room")
                    # Observe each unvisited room to see if it contains a TV

behavior turn_on_off_tv(tv:item, remote_control:item):
    body:
        achieve close_char(char, remote_control)
        observe(remote_control, "Check if the remote control has a switch")
        bind tv_switch: item where:
            has_switch(tv_switch) and close(tv_switch, remote_control)
        if is_off(tv):
            achieve is_on(tv)
        else:
            achieve is_off(tv)

behavior change_tv_channel(tv:item, remote_control:item):
    body:
        achieve close_char(char, remote_control)
        achieve close(remote_control, tv)
        observe(remote_control, "Check how to change the channel")
        # Assuming changing the channel does not require any specific state,
        # we assume a gesture like pressing a button can achieve this
        touch(remote_control)

behavior __goal__():
    body:
        bind tv: item where:
            is_television(tv)
        bind remote_control: item where:
            is_remote_control(remote_control) and close(remote_control, tv)
            
        turn_on_off_tv(tv, remote_control)
        change_tv_channel(tv, remote_control)

behavior turn_tv_on_or_off(tv:item, remote:item):
    body:
        if is_off(tv):
            touch(remote)
            achieve is_on(tv)
        else:
            touch(remote)
            achieve is_off(tv)

behavior change_channel(tv:item, remote:item):
    body:
        touch(remote)
        observe(tv, "Check current channel")

def locate_remote():
    symbol remote_located=exists remote: item : is_remote_control(remote) and close_char(char, remot
e)
    return remote_located

behavior __goal__():
    body:
        bind tv: item where:
            is_television(tv)
        if locate_remote():
            bind remote: item where:
                is_remote_control(remote)
            turn_tv_on_or_off(tv, remote)
            change_channel(tv, remote)
        else:
            foreach obj: item:
                if is_remote_control(obj) and not visited(obj):
                    observe(obj, "Locate the remote control")

To use the remote control to turn the TV on or off and change channels, first, grab the remote contr
ol in your hand. Then, face the TV so that the remote control is pointed towards it. To turn the TV 
on or off, simply press the power button on the remote control. To change channels, press the channe
l buttons, which are usually labeled with up and down arrows, or specific channel numbers. Make sure
 you're always aiming the remote control at the TV for it to work properly.

Goal Representation:
behavior turn_tv_on_off_and_change_channels(tv: item, remote_control: item):
    body:
        # Ensure the remote control is held in hand to operate the TV
        achieve_once inhand(remote_control)
        # Ensure the remote control is facing the TV
        achieve facing(remote_control, tv)

        # Check the current state of the TV and change accordingly
        if is_off(tv):
            achieve is_on(tv)
        else:
            achieve is_off(tv)

        # Change the TV channel
        foreach c: item:
            if is_channel_button(c) and on(c, remote_control):
                touch(c)

        # Select the remote control located on couch_352 in home_office_319
        bind remote_control: item where:
            is_remote_control(remote_control) and on(remote_control, couch_352)
            
        turn_tv_on_off_and_change_channels(tv, remote_control)

behavior hold_remote_and_control_tv(remote:item, tv:item):
    body:
        achieve_once inhand(remote) # Temporarily hold the remote control
        achieve facing_char(char, tv) # Ensure the character is facing the TV
        achieve has_switch(tv) # Check if the TV has a switch
        if is_off(tv):
            achieve is_on(tv) # Turn the TV on if it is off
        else:
            achieve is_off(tv) # Turn the TV off if it is on

behavior change_channel(remote:item, tv:item):
